result.execSummary:
The defendant Johuan E Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**CHARGES CORRECTED TO FELONY SEVERITY**
Defendant is NOT eligible for the the Challenge Incarceration NOR the Substance Abuse Program.
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.

superMiscConds.notes:
All Costs and Surcharges to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions. Sign medical releases for agent.

Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Complete a Parenting Course. 
Complete a Criminal Thinking/Victim Impact/Empathy Course. 
Complete a Batterers Intervention Course.

No contact with DH, YW. Obtain a valid license within the First 6 months.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Be involved in Employed Readiness Program.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately.

records.addlTxt: Transcript from 03/09/2016 for the Motion on Post Conviction Relief

Notice of Appeal and Circuit Court Record
Appeal number 2016AP000665 CR
Order Denying Motion for Postconviction Relief
dated 3/11/16 filed by Attorney Todd; proposed order with cover letter

Defendant Johuan E Hayes in court, in custody, with attorney Leon W. Todd.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called for Motion on postconviction relief. Attorney Todd presents arguments on the Motion to withdraw the defendant's plea. State objects and presents arguments. Attorney Todd presents counter arguments. Court does find that the plea colquey was sufficient and denied the Motion to withdraw the plea. Defense counsel presents further arguments regarding the DNA Surcharge that was imposed and requests a Bangert hearing. State presents arguments. Court denied the motion on the DNA surcharge.   Defendant can be returned forthwith. Attorney Todd to prepare order.
filed, to be produced from Regranite Correctional Inst.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing at 03-07-2016 02:00 pm
Filed by Attorney Todd; dated and received by the Court on 1/20/16.
IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or post conviction motion is extended to January 20, 2016.

Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Johuan E Hayes in court, in custody, with attorney Kathleen A Lindgren.   Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Colloquy.  

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 , 2 and 3.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Statement by defendant's aunt and mother.  

The Court Orders the Following:

COUNT 1

Imposed Sentence of:

27 months Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )
- 20.25 months of Initial Confinement
- 6.75 months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
- Complete a Criminal Thinking/Victim Impact/Empathy Course;
- Complete a Batterers Intervention Course: 
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
- Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed;
- Inform agent of all prescriptions;
- Sign Medical Release for Agent;
- Complete a Parenting Course:
- Obtain a valid license within the first 6 months;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Be involved in Employed Readiness  program;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- No contact with DH, YW .
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge

Costs: $368.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately.
 

COUNT 2

Imposed  Sentence of:

33 months Imprisonment (Credit - 157 days )  CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 1
- 24.75 months of Initial Confinement
- 8.25 months of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:  SAME AS COUNT 1

Costs: $368.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately.
 

COUNT 3

Imposed  and Stayed Sentence of:

33 months Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )  CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 2
- 24.75 months of Initial Confinement
- 8.25 months of Extended Supervision

Term of probation: 3 years  CONSECUTIVE TO COUNTS 1 and 2

Conditions of Probation:  SAME AS COUNT 1

Costs: $368.00 
DNA Surcharge:  $250.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately.
 
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
